貼.definition: to stick; to paste; to post (e.g. on a blog); to keep close to; to fit snugly; to subsidize; allowance (e.g. money for food or housing); sticker; classifier for sticking plaster: strip

貼吧.definition: Baidu Tieba, lit. "Baidu Post Bar", a Chinese online forum hosted by Baidu Inc.

貼士.definition: (loanword) tip; hint; suggestion; piece of advice

貼心貼肺.definition: considerate and caring; very close; intimate

貼息.definition: to discount the interest on a bill of exchange

貼旦.definition: female supporting actress in a Chinese opera

貼牌.definition: to supply products to be marketed under the buyer's brand name; to manufacture OEM products

貼生.definition: male supporting actor in a Chinese opera

貼秋膘.definition: to gain weight in the fall (to prepare for winter)

貼膜.definition: protective or tinted film (for LCD screens, car windows etc); facial mask (cosmetics)

貼身.definition: worn next to the skin; close-fitting; personal (servant etc)

貼近.definition: to press close to; to snuggle close; intimate

貼邊.definition: welt; facing (of a garment); to be relevant

貼金.definition: to cover (a statue) with gold leaf; to gild; (fig.) to prettify; to glorify
